name: Vada Pav
description: A deep-fried potato dumpling placed inside a bread bun (pav) sliced almost in half through the middle.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
description: A style of biryani from Hyderabad, made with basmati rice and meat and cooked with the dum pukht method.

name: Butter Chicken
description: A curry of chicken in a spiced tomato, butter and cream sauce. It originated in the 1950s in Delhi.

name: Dhokla
description: A vegetarian culinary dish that is found mainly in the Indian state of Gujarat and parts of adjacent states.

name: Rasgulla
description: A syrupy dessert popular in the Indian subcontinent and regions with South Asian diaspora. It is made from ball-shaped dumplings of chhena and semolina dough.

name: Litti Chokha
description: A whole wheat dough ball stuffed with sattu (roasted chickpea flour) and roasted over coal or cow dung cakes.

name: Idli
description: A type of savoury rice cake, originating from the Indian subcontinent, popular as breakfast foods in Southern India.

name: Rogan Josh
description: An aromatic curried meat dish of Persian or Kashmiri origin. It is made with red meat, usually lamb or goat.

name: Momo
description: A type of steamed filled dumpling, popular across the Himalayan regions of East-South Asia and Southeast Asia.

name: Dal Baati Churma
description: A traditional dish of Rajasthan, consisting of baati (hard wheat rolls) served with dal (lentils) and churma (coarsely ground wheat crushed and cooked with ghee and sugar).
